message.content:
cs.CR, cs.AI, cs.SY, cs.NI, cs.SE

The paper discusses advanced persistent threats (APTs) and active defense technologies, which are commonly studied in the computer security (cs.CR) sub-category. The use of Markov decision processes and game theory in modeling the defender's problem suggests a focus on artificial intelligence (cs.AI) and systems and control (cs.SY) sub-categories. The simulation of the policy for a conceptual network suggests a focus on networking and internet architecture (cs.NI) sub-category. Finally, the study of optimal timing for attacker engagement suggests a focus on software engineering (cs.SE) sub-category.
